brief_title: Asthma Severity in Children and Environmental Agents
brief_summary: This study measures residential exposures (indoor allergens, mold, nitrogen dioxide, nicotine) and relates exposure levels to daily symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath) and medication use, in a population of children with physician diagnosed asthma, followed for 12 months.
criteria: - Siblings of a birth cohort recruited 1997-1999 - Age less than 11 years - Physician diagnosed asthma - Active symptoms (wheeze, persistent cough, chest tightness, shortness of breath) or medication use in the 12 months prior to enrollment.
